ygData.subject: RE: [archive-crawler] Why is the constructor ARCWriter(AtomicInteger, PrintStream, File, boolean, String, List) not visible.
ygData.msgSnippet: Hi Paul. Binary compatibility is not an issue, here, but we have a lot of test-code using this constructor, where we only generate one arc-file. As an aside,

Hi Paul.
Binary compatibility is not an issue, here, but 
we have a lot of =
test-code using this constructor, where we only generate one arc-file.
As a=
n aside, what is the point of a serialnumber for each ARCWriter?

regards S=
=F8ren

-----Original Message-----
From: archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com@KB=
 On Behalf Of Paul Jack
<pjack@...>
Sent: Friday, September 22, 200=
6 5:44 PM
To: archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: [archive-crawler=
] Why is the constructor
ARCWriter(AtomicInteger, PrintStream, File, boolea=
n, String, List) not
visible.


> Dear all.
> I am just looking at upgradin=
g our harvesting system to use  
> Heritrix 1.10.
> One of the things that =
happened between 1.8 and 1.10 is that the  
> constructor
> ARCWriter(Atomi=
cInteger, PrintStream, File, boolean, String, List)  
> is no longer visibl=
e.
>
> We are currently using that constructor.
Hi S=F8ren,

The change hap=
pened between revision 1.46 and 1.47 of that file.   
Stack was in the midd=
le of adding experimental WARC support to  
Heritrix.  The visibility chang=
e may have been related, but from the  
CVS log it looks like it was a simp=
le error.  I'll ask Michael when  
he returns on Monday.

Can you use an AR=
CWriterPool to produce your ARCWriters?

As an aside, the constructor in qu=
estion didn't actually exist in  
1.8; the 1.10 version uses a new paramete=
r (the AtomicInteger).  So  
I'm afraid binary compatibility is broken anyw=
ay, regardless of the  
visibility.

-Paul
